modules.description: Provides functions to create and manage named threads with lightweight task scheduling, supporting asynchronous execution and coordination through promises. Operates on thread identifiers, promises, and event loops. Enables structured concurrency in networked applications by allowing controlled cancellation and result aggregation.

Provides thread marking and logging capabilities using Lwt, tracking thread IDs, names, parent relationships, and up to 10 log entries per thread. It includes functions to create named threads, log messages, and generate summaries of active threads. Used to monitor and debug concurrent Lwt operations by associating structured metadata with each thread's execution.
